TEMPLATE.TITLE: Utah Legal Services Online Intake
TEMPLATE.AUTHOR: Rachel Medina, Dina Niketaides & Craige Harrison (Started with LAWO template)

VARIABLE.NAME: User Gender
VARIABLE.COMMENT: User's gender will be used to display appopriate avatar.

P.FONT: Welcome! My name is Ayla and I will guide you through applying for help from Utah Legal Services.
Click Begin to start.

QUESTION.NAME: 1b1 - Name and Gender

P.FONT: Let's begin.
Please tell me your full legal name and answer the other questions below (questions in red are required).
If you are helping someone else apply for assistance, make sure you provide the information requested for the person with the legal problem.

Although you are welcome to fill out the interview for someone else if you have all the required information, keep in mind that ULS cannot talk to you if you are not the person who is actually experiencing the problem.
We will need to speak directly to your family member, friend, neighbor or client to evaluate their situation and see whether there is anything we can do to help.

QUESTION.LEARN: What if I am assisting another person to complete this interview?

QUESTION.NAME: 1b3 - Case in utah?

P.FONT: %%[User First Name TE]%%, is your legal problem in Utah?

QUESTION.NOTE: **zip code can just be collected with the address ** refer to lawhelp if not in Utah

QUESTION.NAME: 1b Address

P.FONT: What is your mailing address?

If you are unsure which county to select, visit the National Association of Counties website. Find your county by entering the city in which you live or are having your legal problem. Click here if you have experienced domestic violence or abuse.

If you have experienced domestic violence or abuse, make sure you give us a safe address. A safe address is an address where we can send you mail and the person who is abusing or threatening you will not see it. You may list the address of a trusted friend or relative, but make sure they are able and willing to quickly get you the mail.

QUESTION.LEARN: Which address should I use? Read this if you have experienced domestic violence.

QUESTION.NAME: 1c - Phone number

P.FONT: %%[User First Name TE]%%, what are the phone numbers where we may call you? We must have at least one number. You may list the number of a trusted friend or relative, but make sure they are able and willing to quickly relay messages from our office to you. Click here if you have experienced domestic violence or abuse.

If you have experienced domestic violence or abuse, make sure you give us a safe number. A safe number is a number where we can call and the person who is abusing or threatening you will not answer or be able to hear your voice mail messages. You may list the number of a trusted friend or relative, but make sure they are able and willing to quickly give you messages from our office to you.

QUESTION.NAME: 1c1 - Hearing Contact - Urgent Problem

P.FONT: If you have an emergency or deadline and you need help right away, you CAN complete this online application.
BUT you should also call Utah Legal Services at %%[ULS Phone TE]%%, or contact a private attorney right away.
Otherwise, if you apply online, Utah Legal Services may not be able to look at your situation soon enough to help you with an emergency or deadline.
You can, BUT Utah Legal Services may not be able to look at your situation soon enough to help you.
If you have an emergency situation call Utah Legal Services or a private attorney right away.

QUESTION.LEARN: Can't I just apply here?

MACRO.COMMENT: Example: set a flag if income too high

QUESTION.NAME: 1b Submit Application for Review

P.FONT: Thank you for completing this interview. Click Send to finish and submit your application for review. Note that by clicking the Send button, you are verifing that all the information submitted is true and accurate.

After clicking send, you will then be taken to a webpage explaining how to contact us to finish the next steps in seeing whether we can help you. We will not contact you. You must contact us as described.

Remember: If you are using a public computer or any computer that does not belong to you, be sure to completely close out of the internet browser. If you don’t, you might accidentally share your personal information with someone else.

QUESTION.NOTE: [Notes TE] is compiled in this Question = [Alien no TE] + [Court Info TE] + [Deadline DA] + [No Income TE] + OP Full name + OP Address + OP DOB + OP Relationship w/PC + [More OPs TE]

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes TE=[Notes TE] + "Alien #: " + [Alien no TE]
SET Notes TE=[Notes TE] + "; " + [Court Info TE]
SET Notes TE=[Notes TE] + "; " + "Deadline Date: " + DATE([Deadline date DA])

MACRO.CONDITION: HASANSWERED([OP_First_Name TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP_Middle_Name TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP_Name_Suffix TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP Relationship TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP DOB DA])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_ADDRESS1])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_ADDRESS2])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_CITY])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_COUNTY])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_STATE])=true or HASANSWERED([Other Party Zip])=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Summary TE=[Summary TE] + "Add. OP Info: "

MACRO.CONDITION: HASANSWERED([OP_FIRST_NAME TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP_Middle_Name TE])=true or HASANSWERED([OP_Name_Suffix TE])
HASANSWERED([OP HOME_ADDRESS1])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_CITY])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_COUNTY])=true or HASANSWERED([OP HOME_STATE])=true or or HASANSWERED([Other Party Zip NU])=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Summary TE=[Summary TE] + [Other Party Zip NU] + " "
SET Summary TE=[Summary TE] + "OP DOB: " + DATE([OP DOB DA])
SET Summary TE=[Summary TE] + "OP Rel. w/ PC is " + [OP Relationship TE]
SET Summary TE=[Summary TE] + "; " + "PC said more OPs"

MACRO.CONDITION: [No Income TF]=true and HASANSWERED([No Income TE])=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + "No Inc. Explain: " + [No Income TE]
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + "Ind. Inc. Amts: "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total Income NU]>0 and [Income child support TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income Child Support TE]+ " $" + [Child Support NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income SSI TE]+ " $" + [SSI Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income Disability TE]+ " $" + [DISABILITY INCOME NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income Pension TE]+ " $" + [Pension Income NU] + " "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total Income NU]>0 and [Income Workers Comp TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income Workers Comp TE]+ " $" + [Workers Comp Income NU] + " "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total Income NU]>0 and [Income Veterans benefits TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income Veterans benefits TE]+ " $" + [Veterans benefits NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income self-employment TE]+ " $" + [Self Employment Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income investment TE]+ " $" + [Investment Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income alimony TE]+ " $" + [Alimony Income NU] + " "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total Income NU]>0 and [Income social security TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income social security TE]+ " $" + [Social Security Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income employment TE]+ " $" + [Employment Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income GA TE]+ " $" + [GA Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income unemployment TE]+ " $" + [Unemployment Income NU] + " "
SET Notes1 TE=[Notes1 TE] + [Income5N TE]+ " $" + [Other Income NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + "Ind. Asset Amts: "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total assets NU]>0 and [Non homestead property TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [non homestead property TE]+ " $" + [Real Property Asset NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Personal property TE]+ " $" + [Personal property NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Checking TE]+ " $" + [Checking Asset NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Savings TE]+ " $" + [Savings Asset NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Cash TE]+ " $" + [Cash Asset NU] + " "

MACRO.CONDITION: [Total assets NU]>0 and [Additional motor vehicles TF]=true

STATEMENT.ACTION: SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Additional motor vehicles TE]+ " $" + [Second Vehicle NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Pension other TE]+ " $" + [Pension NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Other assets TE]+ " $" + [Other assets NU]+ " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Recreational Vehicles TE]+ " $" + [Recreational Vehicles NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Work Tools TE]+ " $" + [Work Tools NU] + " "
SET Notes2 TE=[Notes2 TE] + [Business TE]+ " $" + [Business NU]

QUESTION.NAME: 1b1 - Sources of Household income p1

P.FONT: What sources of income does your household have? Check all that apply.

This means all the types of income earned or received by ALL adults and children living with you (or from whom you are separated temporarily for economic reasons but intend to live with long term) and who are related by blood or by law as relatives for whom you have a legal responsibility to support. It includes your partner if you are legally or common law married; your minor children living with you for whom you are the parent or guardian and that you support, It does not include any adult children living with you unless you have a legal responsibility to support them or roommates. %%[DV Income TE]%%

QUESTION.NAME: 1e - Criminal matter

P.FONT: Do you need help with criminal charges or traffic tickets?
If you were given a citation from a police officer or are being charged by a prosecutor, you would need help with criminal charges or traffic tickets.

QUESTION.LEARN: What do you mean?

QUESTION.NAME: 1e1 - Criminal denial

P.FONT: I'm sorry %%[User First Name TE]%%, if you need help with traffic tickets or criminal charges, Utah Legal Services cannot help you.
To find information about your local Public Defender program to apply for help, you may call 211 or go to http://www.211ut.org.
Select Exit to end this program and return to the Utah Legal Services website.
If you do think you should not have been denied, you may contact our office at %%[ULS Phone TE]%% between 9:00 am and 2:00 pm and be re-screened by one of our intake workers.

QUESTION.LEARN: What if I think I should qualify?

QUESTION.LEARN: What if I think I should qualify?

P.FONT: By completing this interview, you are only applying to see if you qualify financially for help.
Completing this interview does not mean that Utah Legal Services can accept your case. Utah Legal Services cannot assist everyone who applies for help.
You should not assume we will be able to help you.
Click Yes if you understand this and want to apply for help.
Click Exit if you do not wish to continue with your application.

P.FONT: We will now ask you about the person, organization, government agency or business that is causing your problem.
Be sure to tell us about the PRIMARY person, organization, government agency or business causing your problem.

For example, if you are having a problem with custody, be sure to list the child’s other parent and any other person or agency causing your problem. If you are having a problem with your housing, be sure to list your landlord and/or your housing authority and/or your management company.

QUESTION.NAME: 1b0 - Household income

Your household is the number of adults and children living with you and who are related to you by blood or by law as relatives for whom you have a legal responsibility to support, including yourself.
DO include your partner if you are legally or common law married.
DO include minor children for which you are the parent or guardian and/or that you support.
DO NOT include any adult children living with you unless you have a legal responsibility to support them.
DO NOT include roommates.

P.FONT: Remember - your computer use can be monitored.
If you are not on a "safe" computer, please select Exit to end this program. You may return later from a safer computer.
Call 911 if you are in danger. You may also call:
*Utah Domestic Violence Link Line: 1-800-897-LINK (5465)
*National Domestic Violence Hotline: 1-800-799-SAFE (7233).
The Utah Domestic Violence Council has more information about computer safety at the following location: http://www.udvc.org/computersafety.htm.

If you have experienced domestic violence or abuse, make sure you give us a safe address. A safe address is an address where we can send you mail and the person who is abusing or threatening you will not see it. You may list the address of a trusted friend or relative, but make sure they are able and willing to quickly get you the mail.
Assets can include:
*the value of ALL you personal items such as TV's, computers, sofas, clothing, beds, etc.
*cash and money in bank or credit union accounts,
*a second home or other real estate,
*vehicles, cars, trucks or motorcyles,
*money in stocks, bonds and certificates of deposit,
*work-related tools, and
*any interest in a business.
Gross monthly income can include:
*disability benefits,
*income from unemployment, employment or self employment,
*general assistance,
*alimony or child support,
*veterans benefits,
*worker's compensation,
*SSI/SSDI,
*social security,
*pension, and
*investments.
